intro: Stelis setacea, commonly known as the hairy stelis, is an epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, tropical environments. The plant features a short, creeping stem with numerous small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive hairy appearance on the petals and sepals. Stelis setacea is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and unique morphology.
